channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for KY
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for KY

item.title: Report X-2023080177
item.description:
Report X-2023080177

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-18T21:11:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-20
  • City: INDEPENDENCE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The cap on the enamo grip became loose. We used spill pads to clean up the spilled product. We secured the package and soiled clean up materials in a lined red tote DescribePack: cap became loose DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed in a red tote.

item.title: Report X-2023080097
item.description:
Report X-2023080097

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-18T21:11:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-26
  • City: INDEPENDENCE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was found on the ground on the load side with the outer packaging wet. The package was place in a hazmat bag lined red tote and taken back to the hazmat cage. DescribePack: One of the caps on the plastic gallon bottle was slightly loose causing a small amount of liquid to spill from the container. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: As soon as the outer package was found to be wet a hazmat trained administrator placed the corrosive hazmat in a red tote. No liquid escaped the package.

item.title: Report X-2023080072
item.description:
Report X-2023080072

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-18T21:11:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-24
  • City: INDEPENDENCE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was found on the load side with the outer bottom of the box wet. Upon inspection the metal can inside of the package was dented causing the screw on lid of the can to leak. The spill was cleaned up with absorbent pads and no other packages were affected. DescribePack: The screw on lid slightly leaked due to improper handling of the hazmat package. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Fold absorb was used for the small amount of liquid that needed cleaned up and the package was put into a hazmat bag lined tote.

item.title: Report X-2023070492
item.description:
Report X-2023070492

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-18T21:11:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-20
  • City: LOUISVILLE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: INSPECTED PACKAGE CONTENTS DUE TO RECENT UNDECLARED PACKAGES BEING DISCOVERED FROM THE SHIPPER. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED EIGHT INNER BOXES MARKED AND LABELED AS UN1170 ETHANOL SOLUTION WITH CLASS 3 FLAMMABLE LIQUID DIAMOND LABELS AND AIR LIMITED QUANTITY MARKS. EACH OF THOSE EIGHT INNER BOXES CONTAINED 10 X 100 ML (3.4 OZ) BOTTLES OF FLAMMABLE EPIDIOLEX SOLUTION. THE TOTAL AMOUNT FOR THE ENTIRE SHIPMENT WAS 8000 ML (271 OZ). THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTERMOST BOX. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.

item.title: Report X-2023070321
item.description:
Report X-2023070321

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-18T21:11:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-10
  • City: LOUISVILLE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: AT THE UPS WORLDPORT FACILITY IN LOUISVILLE, KY A TWO-PIECE CONSIGNMENT FROM INDIANA TO TEXAS WAS INSPECTED TO FIND FIVE MEDICAL DEVICES CONTAINING LITHIUM METAL BATTERIES. PACKAGE TRACKING NUMBER 1Z4499070201205648 CONTAINS FOUR STRYKER PHOTONBLADE ELECTROSURGICAL INSTRUMENTS. PACKAGE TRACKING NUMBER 1Z4499070201205657 CONTAINS ONE STRYKER PHOTONBLADE ELECTROSURGICAL INSTRUMENT. EACH SURGICAL DEVICE CONTAINS ONE CR123A 3V LITHIUM METAL BATTERY IN THE EQUIPMENT. THERE IS NO LITHIUM BATTERY MARK APPLIED TO EACH BOX AS REQUIRED PER THE REQUIREMENTS OF IATA PI 967, SECTION II. THERE IS A PACKING LIST INSIDE EACH BOX WHICH INDICATES THE CONTENTS ARE HAZMAT. THE OUTER BOXES ARE PREPRINTED OVERPACK. THESE PACKAGES HAVE NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.

item.title: Report X-2023071210
item.description:
Report X-2023071210

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-16T06:13:42+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-19
  • City: INDEPENDENCE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package handler found leaking package during loading process, informed manager. Manager called QA. QA admin put package into a lined tote. DescribePack: Cap was found to be loose, causing internal leakage during transit. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Cap was tightened and package was kept in an upright position to prevent further leakage.

item.title: Report X-2023071184
item.description:
Report X-2023071184

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-16T06:13:42+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-18
  • City: LOUISVILLE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1. X-2023071184 SequenceEvent: The cap on one of the bottles came loose and an internal leakage occurred. Upon being discovered, the item was brought to QA to be worked on. DescribePack: The contents were protruding from one side. When the box was opened, it was determined that a bottle with a loose cap was the cause. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The contents were brought to QA and placed into a spill tote. 2. X-2023071188 SequenceEvent: CAPS ON NU-BRITE CONDENSER COIL CLEANER CAME LOOSE AT SOME POINT DURING TRANSIT CAUSING INTERNAL LIQUID CONTENTS TO LEAK THROUGHOUT PKG. PKG WAS BROUGHT TO QA FOR PROCESSING. DescribePack: CAPS CAME LOOSE DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PKG WAS PLACED IN A SPILL TOTE AND BROUGHT TO QA. 3. X-2023071189 SequenceEvent: Cap on bottle came loose and an internal leakage resulted. Upon being discovered, the item was brought to QA to be worked on. DescribePack: Contents were protruding from box due to their corrosive nature DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Item was placed in a spill tote to minimize spillage. 4. X-2023071192 SequenceEvent: There was a crack near the base of the lid on one of the bottles which caused the corrosive liquid to spill out into the box. DescribePack: The package failure was a crack in the neck of the bottle near the base of the lid. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: the dpr, hess report, and isf will be completed and will wait for disposition for further instructions.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: The caps on two of the bottles came loose and an internal leakage resulted. Upon being discovered, the item was brought to QA to be worked on. DescribePack: The caps on two of the bottles were loose and the contents could be seen protruding from the box. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The item was placed in a spill tote to minimize spillage and then brought to QA to be worked on.

item.title: Report X-2023070483
item.description:
Report X-2023070483

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-15T18:13:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-17
  • City: LOUISVILLE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: INSPECTED PACKAGE CONTENTS DUE TO RECENT UNDECLARED PACKAGES BEING DISCOVERED FROM THE SHIPPER. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED EIGHT INNER BOXES MARKED AND LABELED AS UN1170 ETHANOL SOLUTION WITH CLASS 3 FLAMMABLE LIQUID DIAMONDS AND AIR LIMITED QUANTITY MARKS. EACH OF THOSE EIGHT INNER BOXES CONTAINED 10 X 100 ML (3.4 OZ) BOTTLES OF FLAMMABLE EPIDIOLEX ORAL SOLUTION. THE TOTAL AMOUNT FOR THE ENTIRE SHIPMENT WAS 8000 ML (271 OZ). THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTERMOST SHIPPING BOX. THE PACKAGE WAS GROUND FED TO THE UPS FACILITY IN LOUISVILLE, KENTUCKY AND WAS SCANNED INTO AN AIR CONTAINER BUT WAS NOT FLOWN IN THE AIR NETWORK.

item.title: Report X-2023070099
item.description:
Report X-2023070099

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-16T06:13:42+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-30
  • City: LOUISVILLE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: AT THE UPS FACILITY IN LOUISVILLE, KY, A PACKAGE SHIPPING FROM USA TO UNITED KINGDOM WAS DISCOVERED LEAKING. THE TOP OF THE BOX SHOWED SIGNS OF A DENT. THE OUTER BOX HAD AN IATA SHIPPERS DECLARATION WITH PROPER MARKS AND LABELS APPLIED. THE PACKAGE HAD SUCCESSFULLY PASSED AN ACCEPTANCE AUDIT AT THE ORIGIN FACILITY. INSPECTION OF INNER CONTENTS FOUND TWO X ONE GALLON METAL CANS OF PINEAPPLE EXPRESS AND GRAPE APE FLAVORED TERPENES. THE PINEAPPLE EXPRESS CAN WAS SLIGHTLY LEAKING FROM THE CLOSURE. THERE WERE NO VISIBLE SIGNS OF THE CLOSURE OR CAN BEING DAMAGED. THE PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER 1FE015, THE PERFUMER'S APPRENTICE, 170 TECHNOLOGY CIRCLE, SCOTTS VALLEY CA 95066.

item.title: Report X-2023061447
item.description:
Report X-2023061447

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-15T18:13:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-22
  • City: WALTON
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER CALLED TO A LEAKER IN A PACKAGE CAR ALONG THE BELT. RESPONDER DISCOVRED IT WAS TWO HAZMATS THAT WERE PLACED IN PLASTIC BAGS ASSUMABLY BY THE DRIVER. RESPONDER NOTICED THEY WERE LABELED AS CORROSIVES. RESPONDER PUT ON HIS PPE AND BEGAN TO PUT THE HAZMATS INTO SPILL TUBS. THERE WAS NO LIQUID ON THE GROUND OR IN THE PACKAGE CAR SO HE TOOK THEM BACK TO DMP FOR FURTHER PROCESSING.
